page.title: 15FORD LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: The railway line, first run as the Shropshire and Montgomeryshire railway in 1866, was closed in 1880.By 1911 it had re-opened as the Shropshire and Montgomeryshire Light Railway, closing in 1930. Original Ford has some old houses. FORD HOUSE, built early 18th century was owned by the Ambler family.FORD MANSION (c. early 17th C.) was the home of the Waring's.FORD HALL was originally built in 1665,but the present Hall was built in 1729.BROOK HOUSE (c. early 17th ),is the original Ambler house.The stone bridge ,which separates old from new Ford,was built in 1856.The only surviving medieval house is OAK COTTAGE.The original OLD SCHOOL HOUSE is 17th C .WHISTON PRIORY and DINTILL HALL are outlying old houses.A conservation order protects most of old Ford.
